Requirement: Max 64 slave stations (on each subnet)
Max one master station (on each subnet)
Total number of occupied slaves for all groups is 64
It should be possible to run a master stack and a slave stack in the same binary
Same parameterID is used in all groups
Physical layer is Ethernet (IEE802.3)
Ethernet speed is 100 Mbit/s 100BASE-TX (Optionally 10 Mbit/s and 1000 Mbit/s)
Line topology (devices with at least two Ethernet ports and a switch) is optional
Cyclic data use same format as SLMP in binary mode
Little endian is used by each element, where element is one point for Rww/Rwr and 16 points for RY/RX.
RequestPDO reserved1 should have value 0x5000
RequestPDO reserved2 should have value 0x00
RequestPDO reserved3 should have value 0xFF
RequestPDO reserved4 should have value 0x03FF
RequestPDO reserved5 should have value 0x00
RequestPDO dl is the length of the PDU from reserved6
RequestPDO reserved6 should have value 0x0000
RequestPDO command should have value 0x0E70 and subcommand should have value 0x0000
CyclicTransmission reserved1 should have value 0x0000
CyclicTransmission reserved2 should have value 0
MasterLocalUnitInfo bit 0 is 0 when master application is stopped and 1 when running
MasterLocalUnitInfo bit 1 is 0 when stop cause is error and 1 when stop case is user operation. Valid for protocol version 2.
MasterLocalUnitInfo bit 1 is 0. Valid for protocol version 1.
MasterLocalUnitInfo bit 2 to 15: Fixed to 0
MasterNoticeInfo reserved should have value 0x00
Clockinfo is Unix time with milliseconds
MasterStationId is the IP address in range 0.0.0.1 to 223.255.255.254
Default group number is 1
Request contains data only for slaves in a specific group.
The group number is 1 to 64
CyclicInfo reserved3 value is 0x00
At constant link time, the timeoutValue is the link scan period.
Timeout value 0 corresponds to 500 ms
Timeout value is in the range 1 to 65535 ms
Without constant link time, the timeoutValue is the cyclic transmission response waiting period.
ParallelOffTimeoutCount is in the range 1 to 65535
ParallelOffTimeoutCount value 0 corresponds to 3 times
SlaveTotalOccupiedStationCount is the total number of slave stations belonging to one group
SlaveTotalOccupiedStationCount should be 1 to 16
CyclicInfo reserved4 should have value 0x0000
At cyclic transmission stop direction, the slave station ID is set to 0.0.0.0
For slave stations occupying multiple stations, the value 255.255.255.255 are used as the second station and later
Only SlaveStationIds belonging to the group are included in the corresponding request
SlaveStationId is the IP address in range 0.0.0.1 to 223.255.255.254
The position of SlaveStationId is the slave station number (starting from 1 in each group)
Rww cyclic data is 64 bytes x total number of occupied station in group
RY cyclic data is 8 bytes x total number of occupied station in group
ResponsePDO reserved1 should have value 0xD000
ResponsePDO dl should indicate length from reserved6 to the end
ResponsePDO reserved6 should have value 0x0000
OffsetAddrInfo reserved1 should have value 0
VendorCode given by CLPA should be used
SlaveNoticeInfo reserved1 should have value 0x0000
ModelCode should be used
EquipmentVer should be used
SlaveLocalUnitInfo bit 0 is 1 when slave is operating and 0 when slave is stopped
SlaveLocalUnitInfo bit 1 to 15 are fixed to 0
SlaveErrCode value 0x0000 indicates normal states, other indicates error states
localManagementInfo should be used
SlaveID is the IP address of the slave
CyclicInfo reserved2 should have value 0x00
Mask partially reserved parts when receiving
Reserved areas should be ignored when receiving
Reserved areas should be set to 0 when sending
Node search and set IP address use same format as SLMP in binary mode with a serial number added
Node search uses SLMP command 0x0E30
Set IP address uses SLMP command 0x0E31
Fixed SLMP values should be ignored on receiving side
For SLMP the communication port number of target unit should be 0xFFFF
For SLMP the communication protocol settings should be 1
For SLMP the default gateway should be 0xFFFFFFFF
For SLMP the host name size should be 0
For SLMP the IP address of target unit should be 0xFFFFFFFF
For SLMP the IP address size should be 4
For SLMP the server communication port number should be 61451
The cyclic status bit for a slave with multiple occupied stations is the first bit
On platforms where they are available, use memset_s, memcpy_s and snprintf_s instead of memset, memcpy and snprintf.
Different masters (and their corresponding slaves) should use different subnets
Master and its slaves should use same subnet
UDP port 61450 is used for cyclic data
UDP port 61451 is used for node search and set IP address
Model code needs to be unique (for each vendor).
Do not use error codes in the range 0xC000 to 0xCFFF
Also lower protocol versions should be implemented
Master performs master station arbitration before sending cyclic data
If no other masters were detected during arbitration, the master will send cyclic data
Master arbitration for 2500 ms
Master should support 32 RWr words for each of 64 slave stations (2048 16-bit words)
Master should support 32 RWw words for each of 64 slave stations (2048 16-bit words)
Master should support 64 RX bits for each of 64 slave stations (4096 bits)
Master should support 64 RY bits for each of 64 slave stations (4096 bits)
Master should support slaves occupying one to 16 stations (4 mandatory, 16 optional)
Master should send cyclic messages (including status) also when the application is stopped
Master ignores responses from slaves that not are expected to respond
At second link scan, the communication is continued with the slaves that have responded
When a slave returns, the master will enable the cyclic status bit from next link scan, regardless of the frame sequence number.
When running cyclic data, a master will ignore requests from other masters.
The master configuration should include which IP address to use (not which Ethernet interface name to use)
The master station application status (stopped by user etc) should be correct in the request frame. Use 3 slaves.
Master should send (RY, Rww) and receive (RX, Rwr) cyclic data. Use a group with 3 slaves.
Master should send and receive cyclic data to/from a slave occupying max number of slave stations.
Master should be able to start and stop cyclic transmission from individual slaves. Use 3 slaves in one group.
Master should be able to start and stop cyclic transmission from individual groups. Use 3 slaves in two groups.
Master should detect that a slave is lost. Communication continues in the rest of the group. Verify the timeout time.
If all slaves are disconnected, the master should send requests with an interval corresponding to the response waiting time. Start with one slave and then disconnect it.
A disconnected slave can be reconnected. Use one slave.
Master disconnects a slave when it receives the end code 0xCFFF. Verify no waiting time. Use one slave.
Master should not be interrupted by requests from other masters. Use one slave and one additional master.
Master should be able to use constant link scan. Verify link scan time. Use one slave.
Master should detect master duplication during arbitration. Use one slave and one additional master.
Master should react to master station duplication alarm from slave. Use one slave and one additional master.
Master should react to slave duplication. Use one slave (with error generation feature).
Measure master request time. Use one slave.
The master should run for 12 hours without errors (aging test). Use one slave.
It should be possible to run several master stacks in the same binary
User should be able to read information on cyclic transmission status, slave station, link scan times etc
User should be able to read out slave station errors
Master forces slave to disconnect if it receives error response other than master station duplication. See also REQ_CLM_ERROR_06
Master should disconnect slave if the slave sends responses with wrong number of occupied stations
A master who has been stopped by a master station duplication error response will restart after its parameter has been changed.
Master will not send any further cyclic data after receiving master station duplication error response.
Master stops cyclic transmission if it receives multiple responses from same slave ID during the same link scan (slave duplication)
Master will disconnect corresponding slave if it receives end code other than 0x0000. See also REQ_CLM_ERROR_01
Master forces slave to disconnect if no valid response is received within timeout period x number of consecutive timeouts.
Master handles groups independently
Master should verify group number in response from slave
The parameter identification number should not be the same after each reset
Master station should increase the parameter identification number when changing number of slaves or the slave IDs
Parameter identification number should not change when slave ID is changed to 0 as stop instruction.
Frame sequence number is 0 for first request
Frame sequence number is circulated through 0x0001 to 0xFFFF
Master increments frame sequence number for each request
When a slave is disconnected from network, the master should disable the transmission bit, use the slave ID and put 0 as cyclic data in request
When a slave is returned to network, the master should enable the transmission bit, use the slave ID and put valid cyclic data in request
When a slave is set as cyclic transmission stop, the master should send 0 as slave ID and 0 as cyclic data. Cyclic transmission bit is off from next link scan.
Master handles response cyclic data as valid when corresponding bit is on and sequence number is correct
Master turns off all transmission bits and sets all data to 0 in the first request
Master turns on the transmission bit (and stores response data) for a slave that has responded
When a slave no longer responds for the consecutive number of timeouts, the master will turn off the cyclic status bit.
When using cyclic transmission stopped, the master will turn off the cyclic status bit from next link scan
Master handles response cyclic data as invalid when corresponding bit is off
Constant link time is set in master parameters
Constant link time should be 1 to 2000 ms
When multiple groups exist, each group has the same constant link scan ??
When using constant link time, the response waiting time is the constant link time minus the processing time of the master
Without constant link time, the response waiting time is adjustable in the master parameters
At constant link time, the master waits until the link time elapses
During first link scan, the time is extended if not all slaves respond (cyclic response waiting time)
If there are no responses at all, the master will repeat the link scan using the cyclic response waiting time
When a slave no longer responds, the master will extend the link scan time. This is done for the consecutive number of timeouts given
Master will not wait for disconnected slaves
Master sends cyclic data via directed UDP broadcast
It should be possible to select local broadcast or directed broadcast for sending SLMP messages
Master handles response in lowest protocol version of its own and the response
Master sends request message in its own protocol version
Slave should support 32 Rwr words for each of 16 slave stations (512 16-bit words)
Slave should support 32 RWw words for each of 16 slave stations (512 16-bit words)
Slave should support 64 RX bits for each of 16 slave stations (1024 bits)
Slave should support 64 RY bits for each of 16 slave stations (1024 bits)
Slave should support occupying one to 16 stations
One slave should only have one master
Slave does not respond if its IP address not is in the request
The slave configuration should include which IP address to use (not which Ethernet interface name to use)
Slave should deliver protocol version, vendor code, model name code, device version and error code in CCIEFB response.
Slave should send (RX, Rwr) and receive cyclic data (RY, Rww) when occupying max number of slave stations.
Slave should send (RX, Rwr) and receive cyclic data (RY, Rww) when occupying min number of slave stations.
Slave should react to master starting and stopping the cyclic data communication (it should not send response)
Slave should be able to stop the cyclic data communication
Slave should react to master operating status (stopped by user etc).
Slave should send an alarm (to the new master) if another master appears during cyclic communication. Continue communicating with first master.
Slave should detect master station disconnection
Slave should detect slave station duplication at startup, and does not execute cyclic communication.
Slave should send an alarm when it receives data for wrong number of occupied slave stations.
Measure slave response time
Slave should respond to node search. Check all fields in the response
It should be possible to remotely set IP address of the slave. Check the response.
The CSP+ file should have no format errors
The CSP+ file contents should be correct
The slave should run for 12 hours without errors (aging test).
When its master is undetermined, a slave should use the master station in a request as its new master
When slave disconnects, the control master is set to undetermined
Slave uses 64 bytes cyclic Rww data from the request for each of its occupied stations
Slave uses cyclic data in the request at a position determined by its slave station number
Slave uses 8 bytes cyclic RY data from the request for each of its occupied stations
Slave should respond with error if it not can handle the number of occupied stations given in the request. See also REQ_CLS_ERROR_10
When sending an error message, the slave should fill the cyclic data with 0 (for correct number of occupied stations)
When sending an error message, the slave should use at least one station of cyclic data when master is undetermined
Slave should only use end codes 0x0000, 0xCFE0, 0xCFE1, 0xCFF0, 0xCFFF
Slave will resend the disconnection notification if the next request has the cyclic status bit on
Slave should send end code 0xCFFF when it would like to disconnect (including user operations)
When slave receives request from other master than the control master, it responds to the other master with master station duplication
Slave should send end code 0xCFE0 to indicate master station duplication
Slave should send end code 0xCFF0 to indicate error in slave
Slave should send end code 0xCFE1 to indicate wrong number of occupied slave stations. See also REQ_CLS_ERROR_01
Slave should send end code 0xCFF0 when it detects communication load limit
At communication errors, set the end code in the response
At slave specific errors when communication is available, set error code in slave station notification
At slave specific errors when communication not is available, set error code in slave station notification and set end code to 0xCFF0
When a slave detects slave station duplication it should report it to the slave application.
Slave finds its group number by looking only in the message with its IP address
A slave belongs only to one group.
Slave puts its group number in the response
Slave does not have to recalculate data offset if the parameter identification number is the same as in last frame
Slave should recalculate data offset when it receives first cyclic data (while master is undetermined)
Slave should recalculate data offset when parameter identification number has changed
Slave should recalculate data offset when sequence number is 0
A slave can discard requests to other groups as long as the parameterID not has changed
Slave puts the frame sequence number in the response
Slave should set IP address when receiving command
Slave calculates number of occupied stations from the number of subsequent 255.255.255.255 in the slaveID field
Slave calculates stationnumber from position of its slaveID
When occupying multiple stations, the slave station number is the decided by the first
Slave sends cyclic response data set to 0 when corresponding bit is off
Slave handles request cyclic data as invalid when corresponding bit is off (0 data is stored)
Slave handles request cyclic data as valid when corresponding bit is on
Slave should not respond to the request if the cyclic status bit is set when the master is undetermined (slave duplication)
Slave sends valid cyclic response data when corresponding bit is on
A slave considers itself disconnected when it not has received requests for timeout period x number of consecutive timeouts.
Slave sends cyclic data via UDP unicast
Use UDP destination port 45237 for SLMP node search ??
It should be possible to select local broadcast or directed broadcast for sending SLMP messages
Slave should operate safely when master is stopped
Slave handle request message in lowest protocol version of its own and the request
Slave sends response in its own protocol version
When masterLocalUnit info is stopped by user in protocol version 2, the slave stops or continues its operation according to setting of its own
When masterLocalUnit info is stopped due to error in protocol version 2, the slave stops its operation
When masterLocalUnit info is stopped in protocol version 1, the slave holds or clear output according to setting of its own
